title: Andrew Ridgeley 'had no idea George Michael was gay' before he came out to him

Andrew Ridgeley has recalled the moment George Michael told him he was gay - and he had no inkling.

Andrew says George came out to him while they were in Ibiza, Spain, filming the music video for Club Tropicana.

According to Andrew, George said: "I didn't know whether to tell you this... but I'm going to: I'm gay."

Andrew was unsuspecting of his friend's sexuality and he said he replied: "Oh, OK. Well, that's a bit of a surprise!"

Andrew said that after coming out, George was "more relaxed", "probably because he realised it had made no difference to me whatsoever".

(Image: PA)

(Image: Getty Images)

Andrew also recalls the final meeting with Wham! bandmate George Michael before they split up after six years together.

The former school friends formed Wham! in 1980 and during their time together became one of the world's biggest pop groups thanks to hits including Wake Me Up Before You Go-Go and Careless Whisper.

George went on to have a hugely successful solo career before his death on Christmas Day in 2016 at the age of 53.

Andrew has now released a memoir about his friendship with Michael entitled Wham!, George And Me.

(Image: Getty Images)

(Image: Redferns)

Speaking on the BBC's The One Show, Andrew revealed the rather unremarkable final meeting of the boy band favourites.

He said: "Yes, over a game of Scrabble. I was getting revenge for a thorough tonking the week previously."

He did not say when the meeting was, but Andrew has discussed his friendship with George in-depth in his new book, giving fans an insight into life inside the band.
